class.name: Quat
class.description: Quaternion is a 4 dimensional vector that is used to represent a rotation. It mainly exists to perform SLERP (spherical-linear interpolation) between to rotations obtained by a Matrix3 cheaply. Adding quaternions also cheaply adds the rotations, however quaternions need to be often normalized, or else they suffer from precision issues.

method.name: dot
method.description: Returns the dot product between two quaternions.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the quaternion (applies to the inverse rotation too).

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion, squared.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the quaternion, normalized to unit length.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Perform a spherical-linear interpolation with another quaternion.
